description: A cooked stalk from a cattail plant.  Its fibrous outer leaves have been stripped away, and now it is quite delicious.
A cooked stalk from a plant.  Its fibrous outer leaves have been stripped away, and now it is quite delicious.
A roasted root from a cattail plant.  Its fibrous outer core is charred black, so you can remove it and chew on the dry inside.
//: The flag below implies that part of root got burned and has to be removed

description: Sticky, gooey carbohydrate paste extracted from plants.  Spoils rather quickly if not prepared for storage.
Exposed cloves of garlic that have been coated in oil and then roasted.  Much better than eating them raw.
A chili pepper that has been roasted on high heat, with the skin removed.  This has taken out most of the spice, and it's much better than eating it raw.
Cooked leaves from wild dandelions.  Tasty and nutritious.
Wild dandelion flowers that have been pan fried.  Very tasty and nutritious.
Cooked burdock leaves.  Tasty and nutritious.
Wild burdocks that have been battered and deep-fried.  Very tasty and nutritious.
Wild dandelions and burdocks that have been battered and deep-fried.  Very tasty and nutritious.
Peeled and cooked bamboo shoots.  Tasty and nutritious.
Raw bamboo shoots that have been peeled, battered and deep-fried.  Very tasty and nutritious.
A freshly-cooked chunk of plant matter, tasty and nutritious.
Cooked wild edible plants.  An interesting mix of flavors.
A dish in which vegetables are set into a gelatin made from a plant stock.
//: TODO: Confirm nutrition facts for aspic

description: A serving of cooked buckwheat porridge.  Healthy and nutritious but bland.
Canned corn in water.  Eat up!
An ear of corn cooked in foil.
Corn roasted in a frying pan with herbs and spices.
Popcorn kernels which have been cooked in an alkaline solution and then rinsed, making them better suited for eating or cooking.
This yellow cornmeal is useful for baking.

//: real world measurements: 250ml of cooked beans is 240g with 316 calores, and 250ml of veggies is ~100g with ~100 calories
description: Slow-cooked beans with vegetables.  Tasty and very filling.

//: real world measurements: 250ml of dry rice weighs 200g and has 720 calories
description: Dehydrated long-grain rice.  Tasty and nutritious when cooked, virtually inedible when dry.
Raw, milled wild rice.  Tasty and nutritious when cooked, virtually inedible when dry.

//: real world measurements: 250ml of cooked rice weighs 200g and has 260 calores, rice roughly triples when cooked
description: A hearty serving of cooked long-grain white rice.

//: real world measurements: 100g wild rice has 101 kcal.
description: A hearty serving of cooked wild rice.

//: real world measurements: 250ml cooked rice is 200g with 260 calores, 250mL of veggies is ~100g with ~100 calories
description: Delicious fried rice with vegetables.  Tasty and very filling.

//: real world measurements: 250ml of cooked beans weighs 240g with 316 calories, 250ml of cooked rice weighs 200g with 260 calories
description: A serving of beans and rice that has been cooked together.  Delicious and healthy!

Coming from a word meaning "broken corn kernels" in the language of the Narragansett, it is a popular dish during hard times and Thanksgiving in New England.  Incorporating maize and beans (or a similar legume), it is cheap and made from common ingredients.
Succotash, but made more modern and tasty by adding some flavorful ingredients.
Delicious tofu fried rice with vegetables.  Tasty and very filling.
A tofu stirfry with rice and a sweet, bold flavor sure to stay on your mind through these dark days.

//: real world measurements: 250 mL of cooked beans is 240g w 316 calories, 250ml cooked rice is 200g w 260 calories, and 250mL of veggies is ~100g w ~100 calories
description: Slow-cooked beans and rice with vegetables and seasonings.  Tasty and very filling.
A delicious baked potato or other tuber.  Got any sour cream?
A boiled potato or other tuber, the keystone of comfort food.
A boiled lotus rhizome, with a soft taste.
The much less sweet and more starchy relative of the banana, that has been cooked to make it better suited for eating.
A simple, tasty roasted carrot.
Grilled glazed carrots, topped with some aromatic herbs.  Simply divine.
A simple dish made by cooking pumpkin pulp and then mashing.
A delicious baked pie with a tasty vegetable filling.
A vegetarian pizza, with delicious tomato sauce and a fluffy crust.  Its smell brings back great memories.
Olive oil, basil, garlic, and pine nuts.  Simple and delicious.
This mushy pile of vegetable matter was boiled and canned in an earlier life.  Better eat it before it oozes through your fingers.
Vegetable chunks pickled in a salt bath.  Goes well with burgers, if you can find one.
Spaghetti with a generous helping of pesto on top.  Yum!
A pickled cucumber.  Rather sour, but tastes good and lasts for a long time.
A delicious sautee of lovely diced onions and sauerkraut.  The smell alone is enough to make your mouth water.
//: assumes the sauerkraut and onions cook down to half their raw values.  vitamins and calories are the two added together

description: A serving of crisply brined and canned vegetable matter.  Tasty and nutritious.
Dehydrated vegetable flakes.  With proper storage, this dried food will remain edible for an incredibly long time.
A dehydrated chili pepper.  Still not great, but you can easily ground or mill it into powder.
Dehydrated garlic.  You definitely don't want to eat these like this, but they can be milled or grounded into garlic powder.
A handful of dried corn kernels.
Reconstituted vegetable flakes, which are much more enjoyable to eat now that they have been rehydrated.
Reconstituted chili pepper.  It isn't less spicy after dehydrating and rehydrating but it can be used to flavor your dishes again.

Reconstituted garlic cloves, much more edible than its dehydrated state, although the flavor and texture has changed in the process.  Can be used for recipes, albeit its shelf life is shortened by a great margin.
Reconstituted corn kernels, much more enjoyable to eat now that they have been rehydrated.
A salad made with all kind of vegetables.
A dried salad packed in a box with mayonnaise and ketchup.  Add water to enjoy.
A dried salad with water added, not very tasty but still a decent substitution for real salad.
Baking this dahlia root has broken down the starch, making it softer and sweeter.
Now that it's been properly cooked, this salsify tastes vaguely like oysters.  Makes a great side dish.
//: From Oregon Trail. Be prepared to lose it as soon as your wagon tips over.

description: A serving of sticky vinegared rice, commonly used in sushi.
A triangular block of tasty sushi rice with a healthy green vegetable folded around it.
Delicious chopped vegetables wrapped in tasty sushi rice and rolled up in a healthy green vegetable.
Pieces of alien mushroom that have been dried to prevent them from rotting away.  They will still poison you if you eat them.
This crunchy, sour topping made from lettuce or cabbage is perfect for your hot dogs and hamburgers, or, if you're desperate, straight to your stomach.
A less prickly version of cactus pads.
Boiled fiddleheads.  Not bad, but would be better sauteed in butter.
Fiddleheads sauteed in fat.  Tender and delicious.
Most of this artichoke's inulin has been converted into fructose after cooking, and it now tastes pleasantly sweet.
Still crunchy but much more palatable than raw, with a slight nutty taste.
A cored and cooked bell pepper.  It is far more enjoyable now that the seeds are removed.
Ground nuts that have been peeled and then boiled, to destroy the harmful protease inhibitors.  Safe to eat, but need further cooking to become palatable.  Can be used much like potatoes.
Boiled ground nuts.  They look and taste a little like potatoes, but with a slight nutty taste.
Chopped tomatoes, spices, and any number of other vegetables, used as a condiment in Mexican food.  Not so good on its own, but great in a dish.
A Greek eggplant dip.  The eggplants are baked until almost falling apart and seasoned with a big help of garlic, then mixed with some oil and acid.
Onions cooked up in oil and spices, often used as a topping or side in dishes.
